definition: ostentation/a show of extravagance/grand style/red tape
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: It's big, but not as big as some wealthier people in China.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，还不如一些有钱人的排场。

sentences.english: Also, in China a wedding ceremony is largely a way for the couple`s parents to demonstrate their financial status.
sentences.chinese: 而且，在中国，对双方父母而言，婚礼讲的是排场。

sentences.english: TO MUCH fanfare, Italy celebrated 150 years since its unification two weeks ago.
sentences.chinese: 两周前意大利很排场地庆祝了150周年统一纪念。

sentences.english: He likes to treat his date in a big way .
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢大排场地招待女友。

definition: to put on airs/to be ostentatious
(of the groom's family) to send a bridal sedan chair 花轎|花轿 to fetch the bride/to send a party to escort the bride to the groom's house
to muster large forces/to get a great number of people involved (in carrying out some task)
to parade one's wealth/to be ostentatious and extravagant
to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
